snippet: The pharmaceutical industry is challenging a California law that stipulates it pay for the proper disposal of leftover pills that could otherwise pose a threat to the environment.
abstract: Brand name and generic drug makers, usually adversaries, have teamed up to challenge California law that stipulates they pay for program that would properly dispose of expired medications; law addresses growing realization that leftover medications present a variety of public health dangers and damage to environment when flushed down toilets.
lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical industry is challenging a California law that stipulates it pay for the proper disposal of leftover pills that could otherwise pose a threat to the environment.

headline.seo: Drug Makers Challenge Pill Disposal Law in California
headline.main: Unused Pills Raise Issue of Disposal and Risks
headline.print_headline: Unused Pills Raise Issue Of Disposal And Risks
